titleStmt.title: A true and perfect account of a strange and dreadful apparition which lately infested and sunk a ship bound for New-Castle, called, The Hope-well of London. And of the strange deliverance of John Pye master, and nine men more; who were all examined and sworn to the following relation before Justice Wood of London. With allowance. Roger L'Estrange, March 30. 1672.
titleStmt.author: Pye, John, Master.
Jemson, Nathaniel.

notesStmt.note: The account given in the first person by John Pye.
The preface, "A letter from a friend, in reference to the following relation," signed: Nathan Jemson.
Reproduction of the original in the National Library of Scotland.
